alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Eastern Hampden; Eastern Hampshire; Western Hampden; Western Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 8:09PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Tolland, northern Hartford, southeastern Hampshire, south central Franklin and central Hampden Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 809 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Easthampton, or near Northampton, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Little to no impact from hail is expected. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Chicopee, Enfield, Westfield, Holyoke, Amherst, Northampton, Agawam, West Springfield, Ludlow, South Hadley, Easthampton, Longmeadow, East Longmeadow, Belchertown, Wilbraham, Palmer, Somers, Ware and Monson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle. This storm may intensify and become severe. Stay tuned to your local media for updates and possible warnings.
